item.title: Farah-Silvana add a quote by Helen Fielding
item.description: "It struck me as pretty ridiculous to be called Mr. Darcy and to stand on your own looking snooty at a party. It's like being called Heathcliff and insisting on spending the entire evening in the garden, shouting "Cathy" and banging your head against a tree." -- Helen Fielding

item.title: Farah-Silvana add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Farah-Silvana add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Farah-Silvana add a quote by Ronald Giphart
item.description: "Godveromme.' Verliefdheid zit hem soms in een woord. Ik hou van vrouwen die godverdomme zeggen." -- Ronald Giphart

item.title: Farah-Silvana add a quote by Ronald Giphart
item.description: "Dat zijn de rotste momenten: als je erachter komt dat je niet de leukste persoon op aarde bent, dat er blijkbaar mensen zijn nog leuker dan jij." -- Ronald Giphart

item.title: Farah-Silvana add a quote by Chuck Klosterman
item.description: "Should she stick with the nice, sensitive guy who treats her well (Ben Stiller), or should she roll the dice with the frustrating boho bozo who treats her like crap (Ethan Hawk)? Winona made the kind of romantic decision most people my age would have made in 1994: She pursued a path that was difficult and depressing, and she did so because it showed the slightest potential for transcendence." -- Chuck Klosterman

item.title: Farah-Silvana add a quote by Octavia Butler
item.description: "In order to rise From its own ashes A phoenix First Must Burn." -- Octavia Butler

item.title: Farah-Silvana add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "That is where my dearest and brightest dreams have ranged â€” to hear for the duration of a heartbeat the universe and the totality of life in its mysterious, innate harmony." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Farah-Silvana add a quote by Jean Cocteau
item.description: "Living is a horizontal fall." -- Jean Cocteau

item.title: Farah-Silvana add a quote by Jean de La Fontaine
item.description: "A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it." -- Jean de La Fontaine

item.title: Farah-Silvana add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Farah-Silvana add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Angry, and half in love with her, and tremendously sorry, I turned away." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Farah-Silvana add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "Depression is merely anger without enthusiasm." -- Steven Wright

item.title: Farah-Silvana add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "I am. I am, I exist, I think, therefore I am; I am because I think, why do I think? I don't want to think any more, I am because I think that I don't want to be, I think that I . . . because . . . ugh!" -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Farah-Silvana add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Three passions, simple but overwhelmingly strong have governed my life: the longing for love, the search for knowledge, and unbearable pity for the suffering of mankind." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Farah-Silvana add a quote by Mindy Kaling
item.description: "Future hipsters will love me ironically." -- Mindy Kaling
